TLCRole.showAs: Minister of State, Office of the President

note.p: This debate record is available in www.akomantoso.org/example
This debate record is available in www.akomantoso.org/example

papers.heading: PAPERS LAID

other.p: The following Papers were laid on the Table:-

ul.li: Annual Report and Accounts of Jomo Kenyatta University College of Agriculture and Technology for the year ended 30th June, 1990 and the Certificate thereon by the Auditor-General (Corporations)
Annual Report and Accounts of Higher Education Loans Fund for the year ended 30th June, 1982 and the Certificate thereon by the Auditor-General (Corporations)
Annual Report and Accounts of Higher Education Loans Fund for the year ended 30th June, 1983 and the Certificate thereon by the Auditor-General (Corporations)

papers.narrative: (By the Assistant Minister for Education (Mr. John) on behalf of the Minister for Education)

speech.p: Mr. Speaker, Sir, I beg to give notice of the following Motion:-

THAT, since the ban (for the last 20 years) of export of mangrove poles has resulted in deterioration of mangrove forest and since the ecology of mangrove forest requires regular harvest to stimulate regeneration, this House urges the Government to lift the ban on the export of mangrove poles.

debateSection.name: question
debateSection.heading: BANDITRY MENACE IN GALOLE

question.p: asked the Minister of State, Office of the President

ul.li: who instructed these people to pursue the heavily armed bandits; and,
if the Ministry can ensure that the families of the deceased homeguards are compensated and that Councillor Sole's medical expenses are paid in full.

speech.p: Anybody from the Office of the President?

answer.p: Mr. Speaker, Sir, the answer is being prepared. The Minister is coming to give the answer.

debateSection.narrative: (Several hon. Members stood up in their places)

adjournment.heading: ADJOURNMENT

speech.p: Order hon. Members! Tomorrow, hon. Dr. Black, you must start with substantiation of that allegation.

adjournment.p: At 6:30 pm the House stood adjourned until 1st November, 1995 at 9.00 a.m.
